comments:
In ModuleStructuralModel.resNeedsMigrating, the XMIResource passed as an argument is cast to a WTPModulesResource without checking its type.  This results in the ClassCastException attached and results in uncaught exceptions that cripple the tooling (specifically a lot of editor stuff like validation and content assist break).

Two more observations:

1) The object is being cast to WTPModulesResource but the only method being called on the casted result is getRootObject() which actually belongs to WTPModulesResource's direct parent, TranslatorResource.

2) On line 202, the result of getRootObject is cast to ProjectComponents without an instanceof check even though the method contract only guarantees a EObject will be returned.

A safer re-write of line of line 201 might be:

if (res instanceof TranslatorResource && ((WTPModulesResource)res).getRootObject() instanceof ProjectComponents)

Although it isn't clear whether this would fully correct the problem since it's not immediately clear why a ReferencedXMIResource is being passed to a method clearly expecting only one of its subtypes.

--Cam

Oops, typo in the last post.  Meant to say:

if (res instanceof TranslatorResource &&
((TranslatorResource)res).getRootObject() instanceof ProjectComponents)

Cross referencing
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=112925
we've hit this same CCE (from a different source) on workbench startup
Fixed for the WTP 1.5 RC1 042006 driver.

I am not experiencing in direct ill effects any longer, so I would consider this one now a "minor".

However,  I cannot verify because there are still several unprotected downcast assumptions in this method:

Line 240: The last "OR" is (res != null) && ((WTPModulesResource)res).getRootObject() == null

This assumes that res is instanceof WTPModulesResource, which has not been established.  Safer would be:

(res instanceof WTPModulesResource) && ((WTPModulesResource)res).getRootObject() == null

Line 243: ProjectComponents components = (ProjectComponents) ((WTPModulesResource)res).getRootObject();

While getRootObject() has been established as instanceof ProjectComponents, res instanceof WTPModulesResource is not guaranteed to have been established AFIAS.
